title: Donald Trump Calls Ukraine Firing US Missiles Into Russia "Crazy"
content: Trump said that he "vehemently" disagrees with Ukraine's use of American missiles in Russia's territory, suggesting that the United States' policy towards the war between Russia and Ukraine could change dramatically.
summary: Trump said that he "vehemently" disagrees with Ukraine's use of American missiles in Russia's territory, suggesting that the United States' policy towards the war between Russia and Ukraine could change dramatically.

title: UK Peer Faces Suspension For Racist Remark Against Indian-Origin Colleague
content: A Conservative Party peer in the UK Parliament has been recommended for three-week suspension after the House of Lords Conduct Committee noted that she had been "offensive and insulting" in referring to an Indian-origin colleague as "Lord Poppadom".
summary: A Conservative Party peer in the UK Parliament has been recommended for three-week suspension after the House of Lords Conduct Committee noted that she had been "offensive and insulting" in referring to an Indian-origin colleague as "Lord Poppadom".

title: RFK Jr Brings JFK Conspiracies To Heart Of Trump Team
content: Conspiracy theories about the assassination of President John F. Kennedy have floated around the fringes of US politics for decades. Now his nephew Robert F. Kennedy Jr. could bring them into the heart of the White House.
summary: Conspiracy theories about the assassination of President John F. Kennedy have floated around the fringes of US politics for decades. Now his nephew Robert F. Kennedy Jr. could bring them into the heart of the White House.

title: Switzerland Revokes India's Most-Favoured-Nation Status Over Nestle Verdict
content: Switzerland has taken a unilateral stand after the Supreme Court of India's ruling in the Nestle case. It has revoked the 'Most Favoured Nation' or MFN status accorded to India under the Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement or DTAA treaty.
summary: Switzerland has taken a unilateral stand after the Supreme Court of India's ruling in the Nestle case. It has revoked the 'Most Favoured Nation' or MFN status accorded to India under the Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement or DTAA treaty.

title: US Boy, 2, In US Accidentally Shoots, Kills Mother With Unsecured Gun: Cops
content: A 2-year-old boy in the US fatally shot his 22-year-old mother inside their apartment in Northern California, police said on Monday.
summary: A 2-year-old boy in the US fatally shot his 22-year-old mother inside their apartment in Northern California, police said on Monday.

title: 'Huge Disappointment' At Climate Hearings: Global South Representative
content: Major powers such as the United States, China, and India have warned the judges not to go beyond the existing legal framework for combating climate change.
summary: Major powers such as the United States, China, and India have warned the judges not to go beyond the existing legal framework for combating climate change.

title: Return Of Syrians Could Cause Labour Shortage In Germany
content: Healthcare providers have warned that more than 5,000 Syrian doctors work in German medical facilities, often in rural areas, and that they and other staff would be hard to replace.
summary: Healthcare providers have warned that more than 5,000 Syrian doctors work in German medical facilities, often in rural areas, and that they and other staff would be hard to replace.

title: 86 Indians Killed, Attacked Abroad In 2023, Mostly In The US: Government
content: As many as 86 Indians were attacked or murdered abroad in the year 2023, Kirti Vardhan Singh on Thursday informed Parliament. A steep increase from the previous two years of 29 cases in 2021 and 57 in 2022.
summary: As many as 86 Indians were attacked or murdered abroad in the year 2023, Kirti Vardhan Singh on Thursday informed Parliament. A steep increase from the previous two years of 29 cases in 2021 and 57 in 2022.

title: Antony Blinken Meets Iraq PM In Unannounced Stop On Syria Crisis Tour: Report
content: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken met Iraq's prime minister on Friday in an unannounced visit as he seeks to coordinate a regional approach to Syria following the overthrow of Bashar al-Assad.
summary: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken met Iraq's prime minister on Friday in an unannounced visit as he seeks to coordinate a regional approach to Syria following the overthrow of Bashar al-Assad.

title: Satellite Pics Reveal Iran's New Aircraft Carrier-Like Drone Ship
content: Iran's new drone ship, Shahid Bagheri, was recently spotted offshore the Iranian naval port of Bandar Abbas in the Persian Gulf.
summary: Iran's new drone ship, Shahid Bagheri, was recently spotted offshore the Iranian naval port of Bandar Abbas in the Persian Gulf.

title: Turkey Fines Google $75 Million For Violating Competition Law
content: Turkey's competition authority has fined Google $75 million, for taking advantage of its dominant position in the AD server services market, the regulator said in a statement on Friday.
summary: Turkey's competition authority has fined Google $75 million, for taking advantage of its dominant position in the AD server services market, the regulator said in a statement on Friday.

title: "Only 19 Indians Remain In Russian Armed Forces": Centre
content: Most of the Indian nationals in the Russian armed forces have been discharged and only 19 of them are currently deputed there, the government informed the Lok Sabha on Friday.
summary: Most of the Indian nationals in the Russian armed forces have been discharged and only 19 of them are currently deputed there, the government informed the Lok Sabha on Friday.

title: France's Macron Names Veteran Centrist Ally Bayrou As Prime Minister
content: French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday named Francois Bayrou his fourth prime minister of 2024, tasking the veteran centrist with steering the country out of its second major political crisis in the last six months.
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday named Francois Bayrou his fourth prime minister of 2024, tasking the veteran centrist with steering the country out of its second major political crisis in the last six months.

title: Israel Orders Troops To "Prepare To Remain" In Syrian Buffer Zone
content: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz has ordered the military to "prepare to remain" throughout the winter in the UN-patrolled buffer zone that is supposed to separate Israeli and Syrian forces on the Golan Heights.
summary: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz has ordered the military to "prepare to remain" throughout the winter in the UN-patrolled buffer zone that is supposed to separate Israeli and Syrian forces on the Golan Heights.

title: The Great H-1B Debate - Where Trump And Musk Disagree
content: President-elect Donald Trump could tighten H-1B visa rules after taking office on January 20th next year. In 2020, he tried to prune immigrants coming in by issuing an executive order suspending issuance of H-1B visas.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump could tighten H-1B visa rules after taking office on January 20th next year. In 2020, he tried to prune immigrants coming in by issuing an executive order suspending issuance of H-1B visas.

title: Opinion: President-Elect Trump Has Kept Up With Candidate Trump
content: In the last few days, Trump has been outlining his administration's policy priorities and making it quite clear that he sees no need to go back on most aspects of his campaign promises.
summary: In the last few days, Trump has been outlining his administration's policy priorities and making it quite clear that he sees no need to go back on most aspects of his campaign promises.

title: US Boy, 15, Has Fingers Amputated After Vape Explodes In His Face
content: A 15-year-old boy in the US suffered severe injuries and had his finger amputated after his vape exploded in his face.
summary: A 15-year-old boy in the US suffered severe injuries and had his finger amputated after his vape exploded in his face.

title: "Dopest City Name": Musk Launches Bid to Turn SpaceX Into Texas City
content: Elon Musk is planning to develop Starbase as a self-sufficient hub for rocket innovation and beyond.
summary: Elon Musk is planning to develop Starbase as a self-sufficient hub for rocket innovation and beyond.

title: Deception, Despair And Flight: Bashar al-Assad's Final Hours In Syria
content: Bashar al-Assad confided in almost no one about his plans to flee Syria as his reign collapsed.
summary: Bashar al-Assad confided in almost no one about his plans to flee Syria as his reign collapsed.

title: TikTok's Global Carbon Footprint Nearly Exceeds Greece's, Study Finds
content: TikTok's heavy reliance on video streaming has made it one of the more energy-intensive platforms, contributing to a substantial carbon footprint.
summary: TikTok's heavy reliance on video streaming has made it one of the more energy-intensive platforms, contributing to a substantial carbon footprint.
